protocol_name: Cost-conscious generation of multiplexed short-read DNA libraries for whole genome sequencing
protocol_name_html: Cost-conscious generation of multiplexed short-read DNA libraries for whole genome sequencing
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"apvhv","text":"Illumina® short-read DNA sequencing has become an integral tool in biology for genome-wide studies. Offering accurate base-pair resolution at the most competitive price, the technology has become widespread. However, the generation of multiplexed DNA libraries remains costly and cumbersome. Here, we present a streamlined cost-conscious protocol for generating multiplexed short read DNA libraries using a transposase from Illumina®. By implementing small volumes that use 1/25th the amount of transposase compared to Illumina® NexteraTM protocols, the cost of library preparation can be significantly reduced, by 1/10th or more. Furthermore, we optimised the protocol to minimise carboxylate bead-based cleanups between steps, further reducing cost, time and DNA input. By developing our own indicies to multiplex nine 96-well plates, up to 864 samples can be placed on a single flow cell. This enables efficient usage of monolithic sequencing platforms that can offer over three terabases of sequencing per flow cell.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":8,"length":1,"style":"sup"},{"offset":432,"length":1,"style":"sup"},{"offset":478,"length":3,"style":"sup"},{"offset":527,"length":1,"style":"sup"},{"offset":536,"length":2,"style":"sup"},{"offset":619,"length":2,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"35gam","text":"This protocol is designed for Illumina® short-read sequencing and requires previously purified DNA. The DNA will be diluted and later amplified, thus only a small input is needed, as little as 2.24 ng. To aid conducting this protocol, program files for JANUS automated workstations (PerkinElmer®) have been provided in the supplemental with descriptions and a list of compatible hardware. Helpful excel sheets to create standard curves for DNA quantification and dilution strategies are also provided. Lastly, custom indicies are provided to multiplex nine unique 96-well plates, enabling multiplexing up to 864 samples on a single sequencing run.","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":38,"length":1,"style":"sup"},{"offset":294,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lrqu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5oic3","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"31498","guid":"EC8ABA80D37111E8B8077B9D77179174","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/82k222e.zip","placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/extensions/zip.png","original_name":"supplemental.zip"}}}}

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"5t2ld","text":"Ensure each well in the DNA plate is approximately below 20 ng\/\u00b5L. For instance, quantify a few samples on a NanoDrop (ThermoFisher Scientific) and dilute the plate with nuclease-free water. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"7B1E01C0D00811E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674007,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"DNA quantification"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"63tnc","text":"For each DNA plate, transfer 97 \u00b5L of working solution into two half-plates (96-well PCR microplate white, Roche 480 light cycler). For instance, filling columns 1-6 on plate 1, 7-12 on plate 2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"139A3B90D0D011E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674330,"previous_id":674329,"previous_guid":"288DF600D0CF11E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"DNA quantification"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d9r04","text":"Transfer an additional 97 \u00b5L of working solution into two free columns in each plate (16 wells each plate). This will be used for 8 standards, done in duplicate on each plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3unh6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9vuhn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"cqrsd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"c1n","text":"Having standards on each plate is necessary for accuracy when generating standard curves later.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":95,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"20185280D0D011E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674331,"previous_id":674330,"previous_guid":"139A3B90D0D011E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"DNA quantification"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"evh65","text":"Add 3 \u00b5L of each DNA sample to a separate well containing working solution, splitting equally across the two plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"285D7AB0D0D011E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674332,"previous_id":674331,"previous_guid":"20185280D0D011E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"DNA quantification"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9jq6l","text":"Add 3 \u00b5L of each standard to the columns dedicated to standards. Perform this in duplicate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"97huj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2f72f","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"1u8j6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"a18ai","text":"Add standards in increasing concentration; 0, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, and 10 ng\/\u00b5L. Then duplicate in the next column.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":114,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"26784A80D0D111E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674333,"previous_id":674332,"previous_guid":"285D7AB0D0D011E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"DNA quantification"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1d1jc","text":"Seal the plate with adhesive film, vortex and briefly spin down. Incubate for 5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"30AF3090D0D111E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674334,"previous_id":674333,"previous_guid":"26784A80D0D111E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"DNA quantification"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ehv96","text":"Measure fluorescence using microplate reader using excitation\/ emission maxima ~502\/523 nm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3oont","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5rg66","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"91vtt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"2k02f","text":"For an Infinite\u00ae M1000 PRO (Tecan), use a bandwidth of 5 nm, top mode, flashes: 100 Hz x10, Z-position: 20,000 \u00b5m, gain can be optimal or set a manual gain at 96. Ensure the correct plate is entered, in this case Roche Lightcyclyer 480 96 well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":244,"style":"italic"},{"offset":15,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"4881D290D0D111E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674335,"previous_id":674334,"previous_guid":"30AF3090D0D111E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"DNA quantification"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"50fo","text":"Utilising the known concentration of standards included on the plate, create a standard curve to determine DNA concentration of the other samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"965i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5euki","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"q04b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"dqbpg","text":"For a Infinite\u00ae M1000 PRO (Tecan), use files provided in supplemental; helpful excel sheets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":92,"style":"italic"},{"offset":14,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"5109A910D0D111E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674336,"previous_id":674335,"previous_guid":"4881D290D0D111E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"DNA quantification"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8uo8h","text":"Dilute all DNA samples to 2 ng\/\u00b5L in a volume of approximately 25 \u00b5L. First transfer nuclease-free water to a new 96-well PCR microplate and then add the appropriate amount of DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fs3c6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8lhjh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"f6eah","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"alreb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"etdmm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fu7c5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"5kshg","text":"For JANUS automated workstations (PerkinElmer\u00ae), to aid calculating a diluting strategy, files provided in supplemental; helpful excel sheets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":142,"style":"italic"},{"offset":45,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}},{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"27gp2","text":"When using a JANUS automated workstation, note that the most accurate tip size is 25 \u00b5L, however highly concentrated samples may need a larger volume of water to be transferred than 25 \u00b5L.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":188,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"A4673690D0D111E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674337,"previous_id":674336,"previous_guid":"5109A910D0D111E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"DNA dilution"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cqph6","text":"Ensure the diluted samples are mixed and briefly spin down if necessary. Can be sealed with adhesive film and stored at -20\u00b0C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"B25705F0D0D111E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674338,"previous_id":674337,"previous_guid":"A4673690D0D111E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"DNA dilution"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1g4ri","text":"Quantify the DNA using Quant-iTTM as previously described.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":31,"length":2,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"E8380D90D0D111E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674339,"previous_id":674338,"previous_guid":"B25705F0D0D111E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"DNA dilution"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2e7qr","text":"From the 2 ng\/\u00b5L plate, repeat the dilution process, diluting to 0.8 ng\/\u00b5L in a new 96-well PCR microplate. Store at -20\u00b0C until ready for tagmentation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aoch6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d7dq9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"3nvc1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"dj928","text":"No need to quantify after this second dilution, samples will never all be exactly 0.8 ng\/\u00b5L, the quantification accuracy has limitations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":137,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"F667A510D0D111E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674340,"previous_id":674339,"previous_guid":"E8380D90D0D111E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"DNA dilution"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bvc5c","text":"Pre-heat a PCR machine or heat block at 53\u00b0C suitable for 384-well microplates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7e3il","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"autks","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"aiqv2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"9q1p6","text":"Ideally, the temperature would be 55\u00b0C (for the transposition reaction), however, if there is a chance of overheating, the transposase can denature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":148,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"29D27C90D0D211E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674341,"previous_id":674342,"previous_guid":"376D2710D0D211E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Tagmentation"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5b6oc","text":"Transfer 3.2 \u00b5L of the tagmentation master-mix into 96-wells of a 384-well microplate (for example quadrant 1 in each set of four wells).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"460q4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e1iun","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"442ce","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3ttp6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"a143a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"aupjm","text":"Perform tagmentation in 384 well plate due to the low reaction volume and to enable aspiration with automated pipetting equipment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":130,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}},{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"9d5ub","text":"Left-over tagmentation master-mix can be stored at -20\u00b0C and used in 6 months or more. Avoid cycles of freeze-thawing; solution no longer viscous and will freeze solid. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":169,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"A1B58EA0D0D211E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674343,"previous_id":674341,"previous_guid":"29D27C90D0D211E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Tagmentation"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bi697","text":"Transfer 2.8 \u00b5L of DNA (at 0.8 ng\/\u00b5L) to each of the 96-wells used within the 384-well plate. Gently pipette mix during transfer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"BBD83B20D0D211E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674344,"previous_id":674343,"previous_guid":"A1B58EA0D0D211E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Tagmentation"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"edn5c","text":"Seal plate with adhesive film (PCR-grade), no need to vortex. Centrifuge 800 rcf, 1 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"C6BD6290D0D211E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674345,"previous_id":674344,"previous_guid":"BBD83B20D0D211E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Tagmentation"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"43i81","text":"Incubate plate at 53\u00b0C for 30 min. If using a mixing heat block, shake at 300 rpm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5av37","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"25n6b","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"9el3o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"bhum1","text":"Start PCR setup during this time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":32,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"D01B26B0D0D211E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674346,"previous_id":674345,"previous_guid":"C6BD6290D0D211E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Tagmentation"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d97jb","text":"Briefly cool to room temperature (22-24\u00b0C) and proceed without delay. Longer transposition times create shorter fragments.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"294q2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"37np3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"bquo0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"7tsgp","text":"No clean-up of this reaction is necessary.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":41,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"DA774800D0D211E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674347,"previous_id":674346,"previous_guid":"D01B26B0D0D211E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Tagmentation"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ecqc","text":"Transfer 11 \u00b5L of PCR master-mix to each well of a 96-well PCR microplate. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"3593B6B0D0D311E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674349,"previous_id":674348,"previous_guid":"F6BBEA20D0D211E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"PCR for enrichment and barcoding"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a2vlu","text":"Add 4 \u00b5L of forward primer and 4 \u00b5L of reverse primer to each well (i5 and i7 oligos). Ensure each well has a unique combination of barcodes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bn8mc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1hikv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"5nqq5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dsped","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"ar27b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"bf8bq","text":"Oligo sequences and recommended combinations are provided in the supplemental.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":78,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}},{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"1svfs","text":"This step can be prone to human error. Ensure tubes are labelled and plate orientations are accounted for (e.g. include blanks in decipherable locations per plate). Using an automated pipetting robot such as JANUS automated workstations (PerkinElmer\u00ae) is highly recommended. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":275,"style":"italic"},{"offset":249,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"444F88A0D0D311E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674350,"previous_id":674349,"previous_guid":"3593B6B0D0D311E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"PCR for enrichment and barcoding"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fek78","text":"Transfer 5 \u00b5L of transposase reaction (template) from the 384-well microplate to the 96-well microplate containing the PCR master-mix aliquots. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"6ED6D510D0D311E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674351,"previous_id":674350,"previous_guid":"444F88A0D0D311E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"PCR for enrichment and barcoding"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6vbde","text":"Seal plate with adhesive film (PCR-grade), vortex and centrifuge 800 rcf for 1 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"76A4F880D0D311E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674352,"previous_id":674351,"previous_guid":"6ED6D510D0D311E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"PCR for enrichment and barcoding"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3h0pk","text":"Perform PCR as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"220no","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1sjli","text":"72\u00b0C for 3 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"30g8g","text":"98\u00b0C for 30 s","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6c7lo","text":"10-14 cycles of:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c2tqk","text":"98\u00b0C for 10 s","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1rfhk","text":"63\u00b0C for 30 s","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"af3ce","text":"72\u00b0C for 60 s","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a3dbc","text":"Hold at \u2264 10\u00b0C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d85f0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fpr27","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"fnm5t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cqeo4","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"c53n","text":"Avoid high number of PCR cycles to limit duplicate fragments and formation of hetero-duplexes. Currently we have been using 13 cycles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":134,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"87FF1C00D0D311E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674353,"previous_id":674352,"previous_guid":"76A4F880D0D311E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"PCR for enrichment and barcoding"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9lnjh","text":"Proceed to pooling or store at -20\u00b0C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"F13661B0D0D311E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674354,"previous_id":674353,"previous_guid":"87FF1C00D0D311E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"PCR for enrichment and barcoding"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aaqdr","text":"Add 25 \u00b5L of nuclease-free water to all wells (1:1 dilution).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2so1c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2rua","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"5p95n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"3dola","text":"Optional, but this helps prevent evaporation and enables more efficient pooling.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":80,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"FC86A700D0D311E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674355,"previous_id":674354,"previous_guid":"F13661B0D0D311E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Pool libraries"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4k840","text":"Add 40 \u00b5L of water into 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"10BA9E70D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674356,"previous_id":674355,"previous_guid":"FC86A700D0D311E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Pool libraries"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c5oqp","text":"Transfer 10 \u00b5L from each well of the PCR microplate (each library) into the same 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube (use robot).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dmtqg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1i65g","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"bsfkv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"cs3i0","text":"10 \u00b5L x 96 samples + initial 40 \u00b5L = 1,000 \u00b5L.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":46,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"19146010D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674357,"previous_id":674356,"previous_guid":"10BA9E70D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Pool libraries"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b80vk","text":"Save an aliquot (e.g. 10 \u00b5L) of the pool for QC analysis on a high sensitive automated electrophoresis system (e.g. PerkinElmer\u00ae GXII Labchip or Agilent Bioanalyzer).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":127,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"240BFE10D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674358,"previous_id":674357,"previous_guid":"19146010D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Pool libraries"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6c5kl","text":"Clean-up the pooled library with a MinElute\u00ae PCR purification kit (Qiagen). First, transfer the pool to a 10 or 15 mL Falcon tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":43,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ecvo2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a8tc8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"9pg79","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"3pmv4","text":"MinElute\u00ae columns have a binding capacity of up to 5 \u00b5g and recovers fragments 70 bp \u2013 4 kb.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":92,"style":"italic"},{"offset":8,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"377F3D90D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674359,"previous_id":674358,"previous_guid":"240BFE10D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Initial clean: MinElute\u00ae columns"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b1an","text":"To the pool (1,000 \u00b5L), add 5x volume of PB buffer (5,000 \u00b5L). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"4C4EFFD0D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674360,"previous_id":674359,"previous_guid":"377F3D90D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Initial clean: MinElute\u00ae columns"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f468v","text":"Prepare 2 MinElute\u00ae columns for the pool (6,000 \u00b5L).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":18,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"6403B990D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674361,"previous_id":674360,"previous_guid":"4C4EFFD0D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Initial clean: MinElute\u00ae columns"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7cq8f","text":"Pipette 750 \u00b5L into each column, centrifuging for 1 min at 17,900 rcf. Discard the flow-through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"67D58210D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674362,"previous_id":674361,"previous_guid":"6403B990D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Initial clean: MinElute\u00ae columns"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7euo2","text":"Repeat the previous step three more times, processing the entire sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"77F48D80D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674363,"previous_id":674362,"previous_guid":"67D58210D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Initial clean: MinElute\u00ae columns"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7rsoh","text":"Wash by adding 750 \u00b5L of PE, centrifuge for 1 min at 17,900 rcf.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5jerq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9cnoo","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"bi8dc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"29vo","text":"Important: without this wash, gel electrophoresis will not work properly (creates a band shift- inaccurate size estimation and elutes too early on automated systems).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":166,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"7EC78810D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674364,"previous_id":674363,"previous_guid":"77F48D80D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Initial clean: MinElute\u00ae columns"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2t6i6","text":"Discard flow-through and centrifuge while empty for 1 min at 17,900 rcf.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"85F10710D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674365,"previous_id":674364,"previous_guid":"7EC78810D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Initial clean: MinElute\u00ae columns"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c6of5","text":"Place column in clean 1.5 mL Eppendorf tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"9D105EA0D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674366,"previous_id":674365,"previous_guid":"85F10710D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Initial clean: MinElute\u00ae columns"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6i9k0","text":"Add 30 \u00b5L of nuclease free water to each column, centrifuge 1 min at 17,900 rcf.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"A636E620D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674367,"previous_id":674366,"previous_guid":"9D105EA0D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Initial clean: MinElute\u00ae columns"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d5i8k","text":"Aspirate the 30 \u00b5L of nuclease-free water flow-through, add it to the column again and centrifuge 1 min at 17,900 rcf.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"A9CC9000D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674368,"previous_id":674367,"previous_guid":"A636E620D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Initial clean: MinElute\u00ae columns"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2hqvq","text":"Transfer both elutions to a new Eppendorf tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"B1829790D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674369,"previous_id":674368,"previous_guid":"A9CC9000D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Initial clean: MinElute\u00ae columns"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dn248","text":"Save 2 \u00b5L for QC, adding 8 \u00b5L of water to create a 1\/5 dilution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"24A952B0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674370,"previous_id":674369,"previous_guid":"B1829790D0D411E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Initial clean: MinElute\u00ae columns"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"80akj","text":"Measure remaining volume. Volume should be 30 + 30 \u2013 2 = 58 \u00b5L, but is generally less.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"2F8E04F0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674371,"previous_id":674370,"previous_guid":"24A952B0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Initial clean: MinElute\u00ae columns"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b7l2r","text":"To enrich for longer fragments, agarose gel size selection can be performed. This will remove shorter fragments that will have over-lapping sequencing on paired-end platforms. Using a PippinHT (Sage Science) or similar automated electrophoresis product, gel purify the library, following the manufacturer\u2019s instructions. A 1.5% or 2% gel to select 430 -1,000 bp is recommended (adapters combined are ~123 bp and generally 150 bp paired-end sequencing is performed).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1u83u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6corc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"aj7ev","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"5fvqm","text":"The PippinHT has 12 lanes, markers can be internal (recommended) or external. 20 \u00b5L of DNA goes into each lane and the manufacturer recommends a maximum 1.5 \u00b5g per lane. This can overloaded to 3 \u00b5g per lane but the size selection will not be as precise. It is recommended to use 2-3 lanes on the PippinHT depending on DNA quantity. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":332,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"42479160D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674372,"previous_id":674371,"previous_guid":"2F8E04F0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Optional size selection: Pippin Prep"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4j0g2","text":"Collect the contents of all elution wells into a 1.5 mL Eppendorf.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"52B50AF0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674373,"previous_id":674372,"previous_guid":"42479160D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Optional size selection: Pippin Prep"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eno9i","text":"The library collected can be sent for sequencing in the current buffer. However, it will likely need concentrating; proceed to bead clean-up.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"75A5E5C0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674374,"previous_id":674373,"previous_guid":"52B50AF0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Optional size selection: Pippin Prep"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"68qm1","text":"If the optional size selection was not performed, add 0.6x volume of AMPure XP beads (e.g. 50 \u00b5L of MinElute\u00ae + 30 \u00b5L beads). If size selection was performed, use 1.2x volume of AMPure XP beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":108,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"84714810D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674375,"previous_id":674374,"previous_guid":"75A5E5C0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Final clean: AMPure XP beads"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ed2rh","text":"Pipette mix thoroughly but gently.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"92C111C0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674376,"previous_id":674375,"previous_guid":"84714810D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Final clean: AMPure XP beads"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9bslm","text":"Incubate for 5 min at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"A0D72DD0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674377,"previous_id":674376,"previous_guid":"92C111C0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Final clean: AMPure XP beads"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f6pnb","text":"Place on magnet rack for 5 min, or until clear (beads pellet).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"A4E9A8D0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674378,"previous_id":674377,"previous_guid":"A0D72DD0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Final clean: AMPure XP beads"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"701r","text":"Keep on the magnet, remove supernatant without disturbing the beads and discard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"ADFB6FD0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674379,"previous_id":674378,"previous_guid":"A4E9A8D0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Final clean: AMPure XP beads"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1t7qt","text":"Add 100 \u00b5L of 70% ethanol (or enough to cover the beads), for 30 s.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"BA8609E0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674380,"previous_id":674379,"previous_guid":"ADFB6FD0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Final clean: AMPure XP beads"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"17vvq","text":"Take off magnet, gently pipette mix and place back on magnet until clear.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"C3598F60D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674381,"previous_id":674380,"previous_guid":"BA8609E0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Final clean: AMPure XP beads"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6kg8d","text":"Remove supernatant and repeat the ethanol wash.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"CA2054F0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674382,"previous_id":674381,"previous_guid":"C3598F60D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Final clean: AMPure XP beads"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d3fv","text":"Air dry pellet, avoid cracking or over-drying (can remove from magnet).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"D258D2F0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674383,"previous_id":674382,"previous_guid":"CA2054F0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Final clean: AMPure XP beads"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c5l2","text":"To elute, resuspend the beads in 60 \u00b5L water (off magnet), incubate for 5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"D92E6590D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674384,"previous_id":674383,"previous_guid":"D258D2F0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Final clean: AMPure XP beads"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cm0vn","text":"Place on magnet rack for ~5 min, or until clear.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"E136F9F0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674385,"previous_id":674384,"previous_guid":"D92E6590D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Final clean: AMPure XP beads"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"99rj3","text":"Pipette 55 \u00b5L of solution into a new PCR tube (ensure no bead carry-over, if necessary place new tube on magnet and repeat the pelleting and transfer).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"EBC093E0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674386,"previous_id":674385,"previous_guid":"E136F9F0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Final clean: AMPure XP beads"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cb3ab","text":"If optional size selection was not performed, repeat the bead clean-up for a second 0.6x AMPure XP clean.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"F3AD62E0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674387,"previous_id":674386,"previous_guid":"EBC093E0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Final clean: AMPure XP beads"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"785d1","text":"Save 2 \u00b5L for QC, adding 8 \u00b5L of water to create a 1\/5 dilution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"FD1252F0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674388,"previous_id":674387,"previous_guid":"F3AD62E0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Final clean: AMPure XP beads"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"at8bq","text":"Perform a QC analysis on a high sensitive automated electrophoresis system (e.g. PerkinElmer\u00ae GXII Labchip or Agilent Bioanalyzer).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":92,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dpb24","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5goma","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"1b3bb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"47sgj","text":"Include aliquots from the raw (unclean) pool, the MinElute\u00ae clean and the final Pippin Prep \/AMPure XP clean.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":109,"style":"italic"},{"offset":58,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"03F6B2A0D0D911E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674389,"previous_id":674388,"previous_guid":"FD1252F0D0D811E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Preparation for sequencing"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3q37i","text":"Ensure the library looks as expected, a single broad peak between 250 and 1,550 bp. Estimate the average fragment length.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"49lkk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9til1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"eb7iv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dm6ji","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"aivrl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2s7ad","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":2}],"data":[]},{"key":"cbqmg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"f38t7","text":"A double peak is indicative of over-amplification; primers have become limited, PCR products have annealed, forming single stranded fragments that are twice as large (\u2018PCR bubble\u2019). As these are annealing products, sequencing can still be performed, but quantification based on dsDNA is not precise.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":299,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}},{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"27e4v","text":"A stretched peak, similar to a double peak, can form if the electrophoresis system is overloaded. This is referred to as \u2018bird nesting\u2019; the DNA fragments get intertwined and appear longer. This is not an issue; denaturation during sequencing bridge PCR will eliminate this tangle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":281,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}},{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"ec98i","text":"If the library size is very large (e.g. greater than 1 kb), there is not enough transposase fragmentation. Something may be inhibiting the tagmentation if the DNA is highly contaminated. Alternatively, DNA input may have been too high; check the concentration and reduce the DNA input if necessary.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":298,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"115B5900D0D911E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674390,"previous_id":674389,"previous_guid":"03F6B2A0D0D911E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Preparation for sequencing"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4cb6e","text":"Quantify the library at least twice with a Qubit Floroumeter (e.g. use Quant-iTTM dsDNA assay kit). Determine the average of the readings.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":79,"length":2,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"45A78FD0D0D911E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674391,"previous_id":674390,"previous_guid":"115B5900D0D911E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Preparation for sequencing"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ih14","text":"Calculate molarity; nM = (ng\/\u00b5L x 106) \/ (660 x average fragment length).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":36,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"air6l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"77o3a","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"72hpl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"48lku","text":"Although high sensitive automated electrophoresis systems will provide a molarity calculation, we have found molarity based on Qubit values and an average fragment length the most accurate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":189,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}}],"guid":"4EE6A860D0D911E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674392,"previous_id":674391,"previous_guid":"45A78FD0D0D911E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Preparation for sequencing"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7uckl","text":"Dilute the library to a suitable molarity for sequencing. For instance, most sequencing facilities require 60 \u00b5L at 10 nM for Illumina\u00ae platforms. Store at -20\u00b0C until ready for sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":134,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"557A01E0D0D911E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674393,"previous_id":674392,"previous_guid":"4EE6A860D0D911E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":"Preparation for sequencing"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6qn11","text":"Send for sequencing (on ice or cold packs). 150 cycle paired end sequencing the Illumina\u00ae NovaSeq 6000 is recommended. An S2 flow cell yields up to 1 terabases, an S4 flow cell yields 3 terabases.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":88,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f7d1s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1pi85","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"7rd57","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1},{"offset":1,"length":1,"key":2}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"key":"845pm","text":"Using the protocol described, we have been successfully generating multiplexed short read libraries for multiple plant species (Figure 1). To quantify libraries, Qubit measurements combined with an estimated fragment length to calculate molarity was found to be the best predictor of sequencing yield (Figure 2). As species with smaller genomes give smaller insert sizes and vice versa, the ratio of DNA to transposase could be further optimised for each genome for the best results. However, Pippin Prep size selection provides a quick and accurate method to remove shorter fragments that would produce redundant overlapping sequencing on paired-end platforms (Figure 3). Increased insert sizes from Pippin Prep libraries have been verified post-sequencing, however not all short fragments were eliminated and have high affinity for sequencing on Illumina\u00ae platforms (Figure 4).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":375,"length":10,"style":"italic"},{"offset":856,"length":1,"style":"sup"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}},{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"31495","guid":"BF990C80D36B11E8B8077B9D77179174","source":"https:\/\/s3.amazonaws.com\/pr-journal\/82h222e.png","placeholder":"","original_name":"Slide1.PNG","mime":"image\/png","width":null,"height":null,"is_video":false}},{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"31496","guid":"C6B3E580D36B11E8B8077B9D77179174","source":"https:\/\/s3.amazonaws.com\/pr-journal\/82i222e.png","placeholder":"","original_name":"Slide2.PNG","mime":"image\/png","width":null,"height":null,"is_video":false}}],"guid":"66BB1F20D0D911E884FB177B19E31C8C","id":674394,"previous_id":674393,"previous_guid":"557A01E0D0D911E884FB177B19E31C8C","section":""}
